mods.abstract: A RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 8th June instant, a mulatto-man who says his name is John Sibley, formerly belonging to Mrs. Ellen Ann Sibley formerly residing in the Parish of Orleans, but since dead, and was set free by said Sibley, in Texas, in the year 1853. John Sibley is about 49 years of age, 5 feet inches high, heavy set, and speaks English only. The owner of this slave is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law, after the legal delay. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas, June 20th, 1857.--29

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
